meanings.definition: The amount that a bottle can hold.
meanings.sent1: I poured two bottlefuls of water into the vase.
meanings.sent2: The picnic basket was filled with delicious treats and bottlefuls of lemonade.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter accidentally spilled bottlefuls of wine on the fancy tablecloth.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like bottlefuls of joy overflowing.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with bottlefuls of shiny gold coins.

meanings.definition: The plural form of bottleful, referring to multiple bottles filled to capacity.
meanings.sent1: The shelves were stocked with bottlefuls of various wines.
meanings.sent2: At the party, guests enjoyed bottlefuls of soda and juice.
meanings.sent3: The recycling bin was overflowing with bottlefuls of glass bottles.
meanings.sent4: The garden was decorated with bottlefuls of colorful flowers in glass vases.
meanings.sent5: The store offered discounts on bottlefuls of olive oil and vinegar.
